definitions.text: a circular segment of a curve
examples: a bend in the road
a crook in the path

definitions.text: the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
examples: he took a turn to the right

definitions.text: (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession
examples: it is my turn
it is still my play

definitions.text: an unforeseen development
examples: events suddenly took an awkward turn

definitions.text: a movement in a new direction
examples: the turning of the wind

definitions.text: the act of turning away or in the opposite direction
examples: he made an abrupt turn away from her

definitions.text: turning or twisting around (in place)
examples: with a quick twist of his head he surveyed the room

definitions.text: a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else)
examples: it's my go
a spell of work

definitions.text: (sports) a division during which one team is on the offensive
a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program
examples: he did his act three times every evening
she had a catchy little routine
it was one of the best numbers he ever did

definitions.text: a favor for someone
examples: he did me a good turn

definitions.text: taking a short walk out and back
examples: we took a turn in the park

definitions.text: change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
examples: Turn towards me
The mugger turned and fled before I could see his face
She turned from herself and learned to listen to others' needs

definitions.text: undergo a transformation or a change of position or action
examples: We turned from Socialism to Capitalism
The people turned against the President when he stole the election

definitions.text: undergo a change or development
examples: The water turned into ice
Her former friend became her worst enemy
He turned traitor

definitions.text: cause to move around or rotate
examples: turn a key
turn your palm this way

definitions.text: change to the contrary
examples: The trend was reversed
the tides turned against him
public opinion turned when it was revealed that the president had an affair with a White House intern

definitions.text: pass to the other side of
examples: turn the corner
move around the obstacle

definitions.text: pass into a condition gradually, take on a specific property or attribute; become
examples: The weather turned nasty
She grew angry

definitions.text: let (something) fall or spill from a container
examples: turn the flour onto a plate

definitions.text: move around an axis or a center
examples: The wheels are turning

definitions.text: cause to move around a center so as to show another side of
examples: turn a page of a book

definitions.text: to send or let go
examples: They turned away the crowd at the gate of the governor's mansion

definitions.text: to break and turn over earth especially with a plow
examples: Farmer Jones plowed his east field last week
turn the earth in the Spring

definitions.text: shape by rotating on a lathe or cutting device or a wheel
examples: turn the legs of the table
turn the clay on the wheel

definitions.text: change color
examples: In Vermont, the leaves turn early

definitions.text: twist suddenly so as to sprain
examples: wrench one's ankle
The wrestler twisted his shoulder
the hikers sprained their ankles when they fell
I turned my ankle and couldn't walk for several days

definitions.text: cause to change or turn into something different;assume new characteristics
examples: The princess turned the frog into a prince by kissing him
The alchemists tried to turn lead into gold

definitions.text: accomplish by rotating
examples: turn a somersault
turn cartwheels

definitions.text: get by buying and selling
examples: the company turned a good profit after a year

definitions.text: cause to move along an axis or into a new direction
examples: turn your face to the wall
turn the car around
turn your dance partner around

definitions.text: channel one's attention, interest, thought, or attention toward or away from something
examples: The pedophile turned to boys for satisfaction
people turn to mysticism at the turn of a millennium

definitions.text: cause (a plastic object) to assume a crooked or angular form
examples: bend the rod
twist the dough into a braid
the strong man could turn an iron bar

definitions.text: alter the functioning or setting of
examples: turn the dial to 10
turn the heat down

definitions.text: direct at someone
examples: She turned a smile on me
They turned their flashlights on the car

definitions.text: have recourse to or make an appeal or request for help or information to
examples: She called on her Representative to help her
She turned to her relatives for help

definitions.text: go sour or spoil
examples: The milk has soured
The wine worked
The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

definitions.text: become officially one year older
examples: She is turning 50 this year
